intro: Manettia mitis var. fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, elliptical leaves that are often slightly hairy. Its most distinctive feature is the fringed appearance of its flower petals, which give it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in shaded garden settings.
